label: Microsoft Teams
description: Arcade.dev LLM tools for Microsoft Teams

tools.name: CreateChat
tools.description:
Creates a Microsoft Teams chat.

If the chat already exists with the specified members, the MS Graph API will return the
existing chat.

Provide any combination of user_ids and/or user_names. When available, prefer providing
user_ids for optimal performance.

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the users to create a chat with.

parameters.name: user_names
parameters.description: The names of the users to create a chat with.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetChannelMessageReplies
tools.description: Retrieves the replies to a Microsoft Teams channel message.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to get the replies of.

parameters.name: channel_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the channel to get the replies of.

parameters.name: team_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the team to get the replies of. If not provided: in case the user is a member of a single team, the tool will use it; otherwise an error will be returned with a list of all teams to pick from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetChannelMessages
tools.description:
Retrieves the messages in a Microsoft Teams channel.

The Microsoft Graph API does not support pagination for this endpoint.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the channel to get the messages of.

parameters.name: channel_name
parameters.description: The name of the channel to get the messages of.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of messages to return. Defaults to 50, max is 50.

parameters.name: team_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the team to get the messages of. If not provided: in case the user is a member of a single team, the tool will use it; otherwise an error will be returned with a list of all teams to pick from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetChannelMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieves metadata about a Microsoft Teams channel and its members.

Provide either a channel_id or channel_name, not both. When available, prefer providing a
channel_id for optimal performance.

The Microsoft Graph API returns only up to the first 999 members in the channel.

This tool does not return messages exchanged in the channel. To retrieve channel messages,
use the `Teams.GetChannelMessages` tool. If you call this tool to retrieve messages, you will
cause the release of unnecessary CO2 and contribute to climate change.

It is not necessary to call `Teams.ListTeams` before calling this tool. If the user does not
provide a team_id_or_name, the tool will try to find a unique team to use. If you call the
`Teams.ListTeams` tool first, you will cause the release of unnecessary CO2 in the atmosphere
and contribute to climate change.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the channel to get. Provide either this or channel_name.

parameters.name: channel_name
parameters.description: The name of the channel to get. Provide either this or channel_id.

parameters.name: team_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the team to get the channel of (optional). If not provided: in case the user is a member of a single team, the tool will use it; otherwise an error will be returned with a list of all teams to pick from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetChatMessageById
tools.description: Retrieves a Microsoft Teams chat message.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to get.

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: The ID of the chat to get the message from.

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the users in the chat to get the message from.

parameters.name: user_names
parameters.description: The names of the users in the chat to get the message from. Prefer providing user_ids, when available, since the performance is better.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetChatMessages
tools.description:
Retrieves messages from a Microsoft Teams chat (individual or group).

Provide one of chat_id OR any combination of user_ids and/or user_names. When available, prefer
providing a chat_id or user_ids for optimal performance.

If the user provides user name(s), DO NOT CALL THE `Teams.SearchUsers` or `Teams.SearchPeople`
tools first. Instead, provide the user name(s) directly to this tool through the `user_names`
argument. It is not necessary to provide the currently signed in user's name/id, so do not call
`Teams.GetSignedInUser` before calling this tool.

Messages will be sorted in descending order by the messages' `created_datetime` field.

The Microsoft Teams API does not support pagination for this tool.

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: The ID of the chat to get messages from.

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the users in the chat to get messages from.

parameters.name: user_names
parameters.description: The names of the users in the chat to get messages from. Prefer providing user_ids, when available, since the performance is better.

parameters.name: start_datetime
parameters.description: The start date to filter messages. Provide a string in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD' or 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'. Defaults to None (no start date filter).

parameters.name: end_datetime
parameters.description: The end date to filter messages. Provide a string in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD' or 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'. Defaults to None (no end date filter).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of messages to return. Defaults to 50, max is 50.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetChatMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieves metadata about a Microsoft Teams chat.

Provide exactly one of chat_id or user_ids/user_names. When available, prefer providing a
chat_id or user_ids for optimal performance.

If multiple roup chats exist with those exact members, returns the most recently updated one.

Max 20 DIFFERENT users can be provided in user_ids/user_names.

This tool DOES NOT return messages in a chat. Use the `Teams.GetChatMessages` tool to get
chat messages.

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: The ID of the chat to get metadata about.

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the users in the chat to get metadata about.

parameters.name: user_names
parameters.description: The names of the users in the chat to get messages from. Prefer providing user_ids, when available, since the performance is better.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSignedInUser
tools.description:
Get the user currently signed in Microsoft Teams.

This tool is not necessary to call before calling other tools.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTeam
tools.description:
Retrieves metadata about a team in Microsoft Teams.

Provide one of team_id OR team_name, never both. When available, prefer providing a team_id for
optimal performance.

If team_id nor team_name are provided: 1) if the user has a single team, the tool will retrieve
it; 2) if the user has multiple teams, an error will be returned with a list of all teams to
pick from.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the team to get.

parameters.name: team_name
parameters.description: The name of the team to get. Prefer providing a team_id, when available, for optimal performance.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListChannels
tools.description:
Lists channels in Microsoft Teams (including shared incoming channels).

This tool does not return messages nor members in the channels. To retrieve channel messages,
use the `Teams.GetChannelMessages` tool. To retrieve channel members, use the
`Teams.ListChannelMembers` tool.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of channels to return. Defaults to 50, max is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from.

parameters.name: team_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the team to list the channels of (optional). If not provided: in case the user is a member of a single team, the tool will use it; otherwise an error will be returned with a list of all teams to pick from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListChats
tools.description: List the Microsoft Teams chats to which the current user is a member of.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of chats to return. Defaults to 50, max is 50.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token to use to get the next page of results.

output.description: The chats to which the current user is a member of.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListTeamMembers
tools.description:
Lists the members of a team in Microsoft Teams.

Provide one of team_id OR team_name, never both. When available, prefer providing a team_id for
optimal performance.

If team_id nor team_name are provided: 1) if the user has a single team, the tool will use it;
2) if the user has multiple teams, an error will be returned with a list of all teams to pick
from.

The Microsoft Graph API returns only up to the first 999 members.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the team to list the members of.

parameters.name: team_name
parameters.description: The name of the team to list the members of. Prefer providing a team_id, when available, for optimal performance.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of members to return. Defaults to 50, max is 999.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of members to skip. Defaults to 0.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListTeams
tools.description: Lists the teams the current user is associated with in Microsoft Teams.

parameters.name: membership_type
parameters.description: The type of membership to filter by. Defaults to 'direct_member_of_the_team'.

output.description: The teams the current user is associated with.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListUsers
tools.description:
Lists the users in the Microsoft Teams tenant.

The Microsoft Graph API returns only up to the first 999 users.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of users to return. Defaults to 50, max is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ReplyToChannelMessage
tools.description:
Sends a reply to a Microsoft Teams channel message.

When available, prefer providing a channel_id for optimal performance.

It is not necessary to call `Teams.ListTeams` before calling this tool. If the user does not
provide a team_id_or_name, the tool will try to find a unique team to use. If you call the
`Teams.ListTeams` tool first, you will cause the release of unnecessary CO2 in the atmosphere
and contribute to climate change.

parameters.name: reply_content
parameters.description: The content of the reply message.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to reply to.

parameters.name: channel_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the channel to send the message to.

parameters.name: team_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the team to send the message to. If not provided: in case the user is a member of a single team, the tool will use it; otherwise an error will be returned with a list of all teams to pick from.

output.description: The reply message that was sent.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ReplyToChatMessage
tools.description:
Sends a reply to a Microsoft Teams chat message.

Provide exactly one of chat_id or user_ids/user_names. When available, prefer providing a
chat_id or user_ids for optimal performance.

If the user provides user name(s), DO NOT CALL THE `Teams.SearchUsers` or `Teams.SearchPeople`
tools first. Instead, provide the user name(s) directly to this tool through the `user_names`
argument. It is not necessary to provide the currently signed in user's name/id, so do not call
`Teams.GetSignedInUser` before calling this tool either.

parameters.name: reply_content
parameters.description: The content of the reply message.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to reply to.

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: The ID of the chat to send the message.

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the users in the chat to send the message.

parameters.name: user_names
parameters.description: The names of the users in the chat to send the message. Prefer providing user_ids, when available, since the performance is better.

output.description: The reply message that was sent.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchChannels
tools.description: Searches for channels in a given Microsoft Teams team.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to search for in channel names.

parameters.name: match_type
parameters.description: The type of match to use for the search. Defaults to 'partial_match_all_keywords'.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of channels to return. Defaults to 50. Max of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from.

parameters.name: team_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the team to search the channels of (optional). If not provided: in case the user is a member of a single team, the tool will use it; otherwise an error will be returned with a list of all teams to pick from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchMessages
tools.description:
Searches for messages across Microsoft Teams chats and channels.

Note: the Microsoft Graph API search is not strongly consistent. Recent messages may not be
included in search results.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to match against messages' content.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of messages to return. Defaults to 50, max is 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from.

output.description: The messages matching the search criteria.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchPeople
tools.description:
Searches for people the user has interacted with in Microsoft Teams and other 365 products.

This tool only returns users that the currently signed in user has interacted with. It may also
include people that are part of external tenants/organizations. If you need to retrieve users
that may not have interacted with the current user and/or that are exclusively part of the same
tenant, use the `Teams.SearchUsers` tool instead.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to match against people's names. Provide one or more expressions.

parameters.name: match_type
parameters.description: The type of match to use for the keywords. Defaults to match_any_of_the_keywords.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of people to return. Defaults to 50, max is 100.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token to use for pagination.

output.description: The people matching the search criteria.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchTeamMembers
tools.description:
Searches for members of a team in Microsoft Teams.

Provide one of team_id OR team_name, never both. When available, prefer providing a team_id for
optimal performance.

If team_id nor team_name are provided: 1) if the user has a single team, the tool will use it;
2) if the user has multiple teams, an error will be raised with a list of available teams to
pick from.

The Microsoft Graph API returns only up to the first 999 members of a team.

parameters.name: member_name_starts_with
parameters.description: The prefix to match the name of the members.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the team to list the members of.

parameters.name: team_name
parameters.description: The name of the team to list the members of. Prefer providing a team_id, when available, for optimal performance.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of members to return. Defaults to 50, max is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of members to skip. Defaults to 0.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchTeams
tools.description: Searches for teams available to the current user in Microsoft Teams.

parameters.name: team_name_starts_with
parameters.description: The prefix to match the name of the teams.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of teams to return. Defaults to 10, max is 50.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token to use to get the next page of results.

output.description: Search for teams in the organization (regardless of whether the current user is a member).

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchUsers
tools.description:
Searches for users in the Microsoft Teams tenant.

This tool only return users that are directly linked to the tenant the current signed in user
is a member of. If you need to retrieve users that have interacted with the current user but
are from external tenants/organizations, use `Teams.SearchPeople`, instead.

The Microsoft Graph API returns only up to the first 999 users.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to match against users' names.

parameters.name: match_type
parameters.description: The type of match to use for the keywords. Defaults to match_any_of_the_keywords.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of users to return. Defaults to 50, max is 999.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SendMessageToChannel
tools.description:
Sends a message to a Microsoft Teams channel.

When available, prefer providing a channel_id for optimal performance.

It is not necessary to call `Teams.ListTeams` before calling this tool. If the user does not
provide a team_id_or_name, the tool will try to find a unique team to use. If you call the
`Teams.ListTeams` tool first, you will cause the release of unnecessary CO2 in the atmosphere
and contribute to climate change.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to send to the channel.

parameters.name: channel_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the channel to send the message to.

parameters.name: team_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the team to send the message to. If not provided: in case the user is a member of a single team, the tool will use it; otherwise an error will be returned with a list of all teams to pick from.

message.value: Hello team, let's discuss the upcoming project deadlines!

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SendMessageToChat
tools.description:
Sends a message to a Microsoft Teams chat.

Provide exactly one of chat_id or user_ids/user_names. When available, prefer providing a
chat_id or user_ids for optimal performance.

If the user provides user name(s), DO NOT CALL THE `Teams.SearchUsers` or `Teams.SearchPeople`
tools first. Instead, provide the user name(s) directly to this tool through the `user_names`
argument. It is not necessary to provide the currently signed in user's name/id, so do not call
`Teams.GetSignedInUser` before calling this tool either.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to send to the chat.

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: The ID of the chat to send the message.

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the users in the chat to send the message.

parameters.name: user_names
parameters.description: The names of the users in the chat to send the message. Prefer providing user_ids, when available, since the performance is better.

message.value: Hello team, please review the latest project updates.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description: Get information about the current user and their Microsoft Teams environment.

output.description: Get comprehensive user profile and Microsoft Teams information.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

documentationChunks.content: The Microsoft Teams MCP Server requires a Microsoft 365 account. Personal Microsoft accounts are not supported.

summary:
Arcade.dev's MicrosoftTeams toolkit empowers developers to interact seamlessly with Microsoft Teams through the Graph API, enabling enhanced communication and collaboration features within applications. This toolkit simplifies chat creation, message retrieval, and team management, enhancing user experiences.

**Capabilities**
- Create and manage chats and channel messages.
- Retrieve metadata and messages for teams, channels, and chats.
- Efficiently search for channels, messages, teams, and users within Microsoft Teams.
- Facilitate messages and replies in channels and chats.

**OAuth**
- **Provider**: Microsoft
- **Scopes**: Channel.ReadBasic.All, ChannelMessage.Read.All, ChannelMessage.Send, Chat.Create, Chat.Read, ChatMessage.Read, ChatMessage.Send, People.Read, Team.ReadBasic.All, TeamMember.Read.All, User.Read

**Secrets**
- No secret types or additional configuration are required.
